Articles.Content: I can open a .dwg file from AutoCAD 2007 in AutoCAD 2012. Can I make some edits to the file, save it, and then use it in 2007 without issues?

almost never can you edit files in a newer version, and later use them in the older version. The newer version should read it without problems, but if you want backward compatability, you might be able to find how to save it in 2007 version in a 'save as' menu.

TL;DR: no
Looks like there\'s an option for saving in a 2007 .dwg format. I\'ll give it a go.
As long as you\'re careful to use 'save as' and what advanced features you use, it\'ll be fine. (advanced meaning new stuff in 2012 and/or plugins from the various vertical programs AutoDesk has)
i use same as abuve btw i have a student licence for them all

i use same as abuve btw i have a student licence for them all

YOU CHEAPSKATE

That\'s nice to know, I\'m sure the whole world will benefit from this advance in licenses
I\'m sure the whole forum has advanced from these useful, interesting posts.
Meh, it\'s easy to get student licenses for a slew of AutoDesk products. Good for classwork, messing around, etc.
Well, seeing as how a license will set you back $5400...
